com.konakart.blif

Interface SolrMgrIf

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SolrMgr

    public interface SolrMgrIf
    SolrMgrIf Interface which an implementation of this manager must adhere to.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String escapeSearchString(java.lang.String searchString)
      The Lucene search engine requires the following characters to be escaped: + - ! ( ) { } [ ] ^ " ~ * ? : \

        SolrProducts searchForProducts(java.lang.String sessionId,
                               DataDescriptorIf dataDesc,
                               ProductSearchIf prodSearch,
                               int priceId,
                               int languageId,
                               FetchProductOptionsIf options)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method only gets called if the Solr search engine is activated
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the sessionId
        dataDesc - the dataDesc
        prodSearch - the prodSearch
        priceId - the priceId
        languageId - the languageId
        options - the options
        Returns:
        Returns an array of integers for the products that have been found
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • escapeSearchString

        java.lang.String escapeSearchString(java.lang.String searchString)
        The Lucene search engine requires the following characters to be escaped: + - ! ( ) { } [ ] ^ " ~ * ? : \
        Parameters:
        searchString - the searchString
        Returns:
        Returns the escaped string

      • sendQueryToSolr

        java.lang.String sendQueryToSolr(java.lang.String query,
                                 int type,
                                 java.lang.String action)
                          throws org.apache.torque.TorqueException,
                                 com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException,
                                 java.lang.Exception
        Sends the query to Solr. It actually tries a maximum of two times to send the query to Solr. If there's a connection exception on the first call it calls refreshConfigs before trying a second time. If it fails the second time this will return an Exception indicating what the problem was.
        Parameters:
        query - The parameters for the HTTP GET
        type - The type of query
        action - The action for the query. Type is ignored if action is not null.
        Returns:
        Returns the SOLR response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception
        com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException - an unexpected exception due to data in Torque (the database layer)
        org.apache.torque.TorqueException - an unexpected exception in Torque (the database layer)

      • sendQueryToSolr

        java.lang.String sendQueryToSolr(java.lang.String query,
                                 int type,
                                 java.lang.String action,
                                 int attempt)
                          throws org.apache.torque.TorqueException,
                                 com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException,
                                 java.lang.Exception
        Sends the query to Solr
        Parameters:
        query - The parameters for the HTTP GET
        type - The type of query
        action - The action for the query. Type is ignored if action is not null.
        attempt - indicates the attempt number when Solr calls are retried
        Returns:
        Returns the SOLR response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception
        com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException - an unexpected exception due to data in Torque (the database layer)
        org.apache.torque.TorqueException - an unexpected exception in Torque (the database layer)

      • parseReply

        SolrProducts parseReply(java.lang.String xmlReply,
                        ProductSearchIf prodSearch,
                        int langId)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        A DOM structure is created from the XML reply. We traverse the structure to capture the information we are interested in.
        Parameters:
        xmlReply - the xmlReply
        prodSearch - the prodSearch
        langId - the langId
        Returns:
        Returns a SolrProducts object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception

      • getSolrUrl

        java.lang.String getSolrUrl()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the Solr URL. It will return a URL in for form: http://node:8983/ Note that it does not include the "/solr/konakart" that is often appended by another method.
        Returns:
        Returns a URL which will be used to access Solr.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an unexpected exception
